an5.235:4.1: “Mendicants, a resident mendicant with five qualities shows compassion to the lay people.
an5.235:4.3: They encourage them in higher ethics.
an5.235:4.4: They equip them to see the truth of the teachings.
an5.235:4.5: When they are sick, they go to them and prompt their mindfulness, saying:
an5.235:4.6: ‘Establish your mindfulness, good sirs, in what is worthy.’
an5.235:4.7: When a large mendicant Saṅgha is arriving with mendicants from abroad, they go to the lay people and announce:
an5.235:4.8: ‘A large mendicant Saṅgha is arriving with mendicants from abroad. Make merit! Now is the time to make merit!’
an5.235:4.9: And they eat whatever food they give them, coarse or fine, not wasting a gift given in faith.
an5.235:4.10: A resident mendicant with five qualities shows compassion to the lay people.”
